blog.name: criticnthecynic
blog.title: The Cynic and the Critic
blog.description: Welcome to the critic and the cynic blog, where we post notes on what we discuss in our podcast, Editorials and movie reviews that are all based around our obsession with movie franchises and how they function.

title: The Avengers: Down the Line
body:
With the second part of Infinity War looming over the horizon and spelling doom for a chunk of the original 6-piece band that launched Marvel to the top of the film industry, it’s interesting going back to the movie that started it all. Not the edgier and politically aware film that was Iron Man, which began the MCU as a franchise, but the witty, corny and first proper crossover that made this cinematic universe the pop-culture dominating force it is today.

The original Avengers: Assemble has aged better in some regards than others, with one of the most glaring aspect being the Buffy-like dialogue that has been inescapable in every Marvel movie since. Silly as it is, the characters have a lot of fun together not just through dialogue but character interactions as well. The fact that the film focuses on the steps taken for these characters to come together as a team goes perfectly with the amount of banter that’s exchanged, as egos and hero complexes collide. The action pieces, glaringly CG-laden as they are, remain very polished and are still a lot of fun to watch.

However, the movie’s problem was never very unclear: Agent Colson and his cop-out death uniting the team feels like the most forced story telling in the entire script, especially considering how half of the characters had exchanged one line with Colson at best. The fact that he is brought back for Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D later down the line only emphasises this cheap feeling of his death being completely arbitrary, a simple vehicle to drag the characters into the 3rd act of the movie. Also, Captain America’s costume is ridiculous, but watching his colour scheme gradually drop into darker tones over the course of his disillusion throughout his films is subtly tragic in its own way.

Avengers: Assemble certainly still holds up after 6 years since jumpstarting Marvel’s unstoppable cinematic freight train.  It’s got the heart, humour and action we’ve come to expect from every single one of these movies, probably providing some of the best examples of each of each of these aspects. We can certainly expect the next big phase of the MCU to be heralded with similar flare and passion.
9/10

blog.name: hornyspacesnakes
blog.title: This was supposed to be a homestuck blog

summary:
Peter Quill is kind of a dumbass, sure
But he's lived in space and been around all kinds of aliens and learned all kinds of shit...
body:
Peter Quill is kind of a dumbass, sure

But he’s lived in space and been around all kinds of aliens and learned all kinds of shit and can fly and maintain s spaceship so like

Hes on earth and at first everyone thinks he’s just a lovable dumbass

But then he fucking??? Looks at a smartphone that’s being stupid because of planned obsolescence and he just. Takes it apart. And fixes it. And then also adds some stuff. And now it can project a 3D hologram

All the earth heros are Shocked. Rocket just fucking scoffs because that was just child’s play compared to what he can do lbr and he’s like ‘god I can’t believe how fucking primitive this place is that that shit just impressed them, even Drax could have at least got it working properly jfc’

Thor sits quietly in the background, smarter than all of them combined

title: Ready To Run
body:
Pairing: Male Avenger x Reader

Warning: None.

“Stop! Stop here!” Your hand slaps the plexiglass of the cab you’d hopped into. The cabbie scuffs, looking around.

“Lady there isn’t any place to stop.” He chances a glass back as you look around. He wasn’t wrong but that wasn’t going to stop you.

“Just slow down then!” You yank the lock on the door.

“What?!” He nearly slams on the brakes.

“Screw it! Here!” You shove the cash you’d grabbed, through the opening in the plexiglass, before you hop out of the still moving cab.

“Lady?!” The cabbie yells for you.

Your feet stumble, but you manage to keep yourself up, and not trip on your dress. Slamming the door, you hurry around the back end and glance for coming traffic, before you lift the bottom of your gown and rush across the street opening.

You yank open the main door, hurrying in, without catching your dress. Your foot comes down on the marble flooring, and your heel snaps with an audible crack.

“Shoot.” You pause glancing down.

You kick both heels off, before picking up your dress and rushing towards the elevator. People are stopping to watch you; your fingers jab the UP button over and over as you watch the floors count down.

The doors open, and you step in, pulling all of your dress into the box with you. You quickly punch in the code and wait for the door to close. It catches the edge of your dress, the sound of tearing material fills the box, followed by your laugh. You were bare foot and your dress was officially ruined, you’d lost your veil on the run for the cab. You could only image how crazy you looked at this point.



He sat at the island, everyone moved around him. Filling their mid-morning routines, with chatter, coffee and breakfast. His thumbs tapped the side of his coffee cup, barely hearing anything they had to say. His mind was a million miles away this morning.

The elevator dings, forcing his eyes up. The rest of the team, his family look up as well. Confused who would be joining them at this time. Hurried footsteps coming towards them, what rounds the corner had him sitting up in his chair, and the rest of them stock still in surprise.

“Y/N?” His voice sounded funny to his own ears.

His eyes travel over her, she’s panting and out of breathe as if she’d ran here. Her wedding dress is short sleeved, modest and the tulle, bottom seems to be swallowing her. It’s dirty, appears ripped and she has no shoes on, her hair was falling loose from an up-do she had.

“Oh sweet Jesus.” He hears Nat mutter as she looks over her once friend.

“I’m not over you.” Y/N has a hand on her stomach as she tries to catch her breathe. “I’m head over,” she gulps in breathe, nodding “run out on my wedding day,” she waves her hand down the front of her “in love with you.” She nods, letting out a breathe.

The room falls silent, as the two of them stare at each other.

body_abstract:
Pairing: Male Avenger x Reader

Warning: None.

“Stop! Stop here!” Your hand slaps the plexiglass of the cab you’d hopped into. The cabbie scuffs, looking around.

“Lady there isn’t any place to stop.” He chances a glass back as you look around. He wasn’t wrong but that wasn’t going to stop you.

“Just slow down then!” You yank the lock on the door.

“What?!” He nearly slams on the brakes.

“Screw it! Here!” You shove the cash you’d grabbed, through the opening in the plexiglass, before you hop out of the still moving cab.

“Lady?!” The cabbie yells for you.

Your feet stumble, but you manage to keep yourself up, and not trip on your dress. Slamming the door, you hurry around the back end and glance for coming traffic, before you lift the bottom of your gown and rush across the street opening.

You yank open the main door, hurrying in, without catching your dress. Your foot comes down on the marble flooring, and your heel snaps with an audible crack.

“Shoot.” You pause glancing down.

You kick both heels off, before picking up your dress and rushing towards the elevator. People are stopping to watch you; your fingers jab the UP button over and over as you watch the floors count down.

The doors open, and you step in, pulling all of your dress into the box with you. You quickly punch in the code and wait for the door to close. It catches the edge of your dress, the sound of tearing material fills the box, followed by your laugh. You were bare foot and your dress was officially ruined, you’d lost your veil on the run for the cab. You could only image how crazy you looked at this point.



He sat at the island, everyone moved around him. Filling their mid-morning routines, with chatter, coffee and breakfast. His thumbs tapped the side of his coffee cup, barely hearing anything they had to say. His mind was a million miles away this morning.

The elevator dings, forcing his eyes up. The rest of the team, his family look up as well. Confused who would be joining them at this time. Hurried footsteps coming towards them, what rounds the corner had him sitting up in his chair, and the rest of them stock still in surprise.

“Y/N?” His voice sounded funny to his own ears.

His eyes travel over her, she’s panting and out of breathe as if she’d ran here. Her wedding dress is short sleeved, modest and the tulle, bottom seems to be swallowing her. It’s dirty, appears ripped and she has no shoes on, her hair was falling loose from an up-do she had.

“Oh sweet Jesus.” He hears Nat mutter as she looks over her once friend.

“I’m not over you.” Y/N has a hand on her stomach as she tries to catch her breathe. “I’m head over,” she gulps in breathe, nodding “run out on my wedding day,” she waves her hand down the front of her “in love with you.” She nods, letting out a breathe.

The room falls silent, as the two of them stare at each other.

body:
Infinite Secrets (Peter Parker) Ch. 1

Warnings: other than total nonsense probably nothing.:)

Queens

“Peter, you are so dead.”

“I know, I know….I promised I would help with the project - but you have no idea; I landed the greatest opportunity and I just had to chase it.”

Peters wet hair was swinging in front of his eyes as he stared at you from the other end of your Skype call. He had a black eye, you could see it.

“What’s this great opportunity, Parker?”

“I can’t really talk about it just yet…” He ran his hands through his hair, clearly frustrated.

“What is it? First rule about fight club don’t talk about fight club?”

You pointed to your own eye, Peter copied the motion wincing when he touched the bruise at his face.

“Scuffle with a guy at airport security. He was really trippin’” Peter was lying through his teeth, like every time he had been bruises or cuts. Had to be an underground fight club. Peter had always been troubled, maybe that was his way of coping.

“Fine, Parker. The project is due in three days, tell me you’ll at least be back for the presentation. It doesn’t matter if you speak-but your appearance reflects on my grade to.”

“I promise, Y/N. I haven’t let you down yet have I?”

“No, Peter. But your getting dangerously close.”

Several days later you were shuffling through the apartment making sure you had everything you’d need. The day off your project had arrived, Peter had returned to school just in time.

“You sure you and Stark had a good time, he seemed kinda occupied with Captain America to be honest. Kinda funny that you had to go to the same place.”

“I don’t see Mr. Stark all the time you know it was just a quick training in you know… Science management.”

Even he looked confused at his excuse.

”Right, all I’m saying Peter is…“

”Can we please not talk about Mr. Stark.“

The argument had ended there. Peter seemed extra thrilled and extra secretive about anything having to do with Tony Stark. The next few days he was obsessed with rushing home to work on his ‘Stark internship’.

"Does he care at all?” You groaned to Ned as Peter once again dissapeared right after last bell.

“About school, the internship, or you?” Ned countered, not even looking at you.

You thought about having a smartass comment but came up short, replacing it with a heavy sigh.

“He agreed to help with my Lego death star tonight.” Ned’s voice chipper.

“Great, he still cares about Star Wars. At least that’s something.” You sighed again. “Wanna walk to the neighborhood with me? Since you promised to meet him?”

“Sure, don’t you usually….”

“Walk with Peter, yeah. That doesn’t seem to be happening today.”

***

“Hey there, little smart ass.” Mr. Delmar called out from behind the counter.

“Hey there!” You said waving-not your best comeback, but you just couldn’t seem to find one. Was Peter bothering you that much?

“You know, you missed Mr Parker about forty-five minutes ago.” He turned to his colleague speaking rapidly and turning back to you.

“He said Parker and girlfriend, must be taking about you…” Ned pushed an elbow into your ribs, you swatted at his hand trying not to blush.

“Soo, what did the nerd Almighty order today?”

“The number five with pickles.” Mr Delmar sounded bored.

“Took my advice I see. I’ll have the same and what ever my buddy here wants.”

“Eat here, or walk?” You turned to Ned waiting for his answer.

“Walk, we’ll head to Pete’s, I’m sure May won’t mind.”

Walking down the streets of Queens, shoveling your sandwich in your face-you and Ned exchanged small talk between bites.

“You know, I’m surprised Peter hasn’t caught on to your little crush.” Ned always had a way of bringing it up to you.

“Because he’s too busy with the little crush…. Of his own.” You rebutled. Swallowing the massive bite you just took. “I’m as much in the friend zone as you, Ned.”

“It could happen,” he shrugged his shoulders-his back pack making a loud jingling. No doubt the Lego pieces. “Maybe you should tell him yourself, sometimes guys like a girl who takes charge.”

“Yeah, and when I’m done with that I’ll ask Spiderman to go out with me next. Or better yet, Captain America- he’s been single a while now.”

The two of you had made it to the Parker residence, Peter shockingly wasn’t home yet-it was nearly dark. But May offered his room for you to hang out in while she made dinner. Once again Ned steered the conversation towards you and Peter before you glared at him to stop.

“The Death Star is nearly complete, my master.” Ned dropped his voice low, trying his best.

“Well done, Lord Vader.” You cackled. Finishing the Lego masterpiece in silence, Ned slowly began to lift it from the bed. It was late and Peter still want home-you may as well call it a night.

But Ned’s eyes went wide, fixated on the cieling. There crawling on all fours, Spiderman suit and all was Peter. You couldn’t breath or even think. He slung a web closing the door silently.

Landing just as silently on the ground Peter turned meeting your eyes and Ned’s. The crash from your Lego creation falling to the ground made you jump.

“what was that?” May called.

Peter franticly squeaked out this response, holding out his hand as if that would keep her from entering the room.

“You’re the Spiderman…” Ned was stunned.

Your ears couldn’t make out any sound as you stared at Peters suit. It was a shiny onesie. He slapped at the emblem on his chest, the suit falling I’m a heap at his feet. He was now nearly naked and almost instantly you were in reality again.

“oh Jesus Peter, warn a girl.” You spun around covering your eyes-leaning against the cold bars of his bunk bed ladder.

“Sorry, Sorry” he scrambled around looking for clothes when May walked in.

“well that didn’t….Peter. What …. ” She stammered, and you could only guess why. “What are you doing? Put some clothes on, Y/N you should come with me.”

“Love to, May. But I can’t really open my eyes at this moment. I’m good here as long as Peter gets dressed.”

“Aunt May I’m so sorry I totally forgot that she was in here.” Peter argued and you could feel your heart sink to your stomach.

Hearing the click from the door the awkward tension burst with chaos. Ned and Peter began to banter about him being Spiderman and something about the internship. You couldn’t really focus. You had seen Peter in gym class and once last summer at a pool party.

His physique hadn’t been that good at the time. Your mind was tracing every line of his muscles in my your memory, licking your lips at the idea.

“Y/N, you should go with Ned.” Peters soft voice made your eyes pop open. He had on a shirt but was still in his boxers- at at least the main distraction had passed.

“Yeah, that’s a good idea.” You grabbed your bag, vaugely hearing apologies from Peter as you and Ned left the apartment.

“So, at least now when you tell Peter how you feel you’ll knock out two birds with one stone.” You groaned at the joke.

Avengers Upstate New York Present Day

“I shouldn’t have let him stay, but the kid just doesn’t listen.” Tony had been rambling on since you had arrived at the complex. He was silent the ride up and it was then that you knew it couldn’t be good.

“I wouldn’t have known who to tell, but Parker was so big on home videos- he had tons with you two-and when I saw the mask footage from his old suit…”

“You still keep track of those, I thought the baby monitor had been removed.” Ned interrupted.

“Ned, for the love of god-not now.” You hissed.

“He was particularly fond of you.” Tony’s eyes landed on you-the pain in them making you feel like your stomach was receding into a black hole.

“Girlfriend?” He asked. You only nodded.

“Fairly recent…” Your voice cracking.

“Then my apologies and sympathy can’t be expressed enough.” Tonys own voice faltering.

“Tony,” you knew you should have called him Mr. Stark- it was only respectful. His body tensed but he didn’t turn. You weren’t sure of your courage in that second-but you knew there was only one thing you could do- the only thing you could say to make sense of your grief.

“Bring him back.”

“Kid, if I could….."he sniffed "I would.”

“Not good enough,” you growled “There must be a way.”

“Y/N….” Ned was crying - accepting defeat

“There has to be something.” Your tears stung your eyes-you hadn’t cried it all out yet.

@avengers-sweethearts @butwhyduh

“What is it? First rule about fight club don’t talk about fight club?”

You pointed to your own eye, Peter copied the motion wincing when he touched the bruise at his face.

“Scuffle with a guy at airport security. He was really trippin’” Peter was lying through his teeth, like every time he had been bruises or cuts. Had to be an underground fight club. Peter had always been troubled, maybe that was his way of coping.

“Fine, Parker. The project is due in three days, tell me you’ll at least be back for the presentation. It doesn’t matter if you speak-but your appearance reflects on my grade to.”

“I promise, Y/N. I haven’t let you down yet have I?”

“No, Peter. But your getting dangerously close.”

Several days later you were shuffling through the apartment making sure you had everything you’d need. The day off your project had arrived, Peter had returned to school just in time.

“You sure you and Stark had a good time, he seemed kinda occupied with Captain America to be honest. Kinda funny that you had to go to the same place.”

“I don’t see Mr. Stark all the time you know it was just a quick training in you know… Science management.”

Even he looked confused at his excuse.

”Right, all I’m saying Peter is…“

”Can we please not talk about Mr. Stark.“

The argument had ended there. Peter seemed extra thrilled and extra secretive about anything having to do with Tony Stark. The next few days he was obsessed with rushing home to work on his ‘Stark internship’.

"Does he care at all?” You groaned to Ned as Peter once again dissapeared right after last bell.

“About school, the internship, or you?” Ned countered, not even looking at you.

You thought about having a smartass comment but came up short, replacing it with a heavy sigh.

“He agreed to help with my Lego death star tonight.” Ned’s voice chipper.

“Great, he still cares about Star Wars. At least that’s something.” You sighed again. “Wanna walk to the neighborhood with me? Since you promised to meet him?”

“Sure, don’t you usually….”

“Walk with Peter, yeah. That doesn’t seem to be happening today.”

***

“Hey there, little smart ass.” Mr. Delmar called out from behind the counter.

“Hey there!” You said waving-not your best comeback, but you just couldn’t seem to find one. Was Peter bothering you that much?

“You know, you missed Mr Parker about forty-five minutes ago.” He turned to his colleague speaking rapidly and turning back to you.

“He said Parker and girlfriend, must be taking about you…” Ned pushed an elbow into your ribs, you swatted at his hand trying not to blush.

“Soo, what did the nerd Almighty order today?”

“The number five with pickles.” Mr Delmar sounded bored.

“Took my advice I see. I’ll have the same and what ever my buddy here wants.”

“Eat here, or walk?” You turned to Ned waiting for his answer.

“Walk, we’ll head to Pete’s, I’m sure May won’t mind.”

Walking down the streets of Queens, shoveling your sandwich in your face-you and Ned exchanged small talk between bites.

“You know, I’m surprised Peter hasn’t caught on to your little crush.” Ned always had a way of bringing it up to you.

“Because he’s too busy with the little crush…. Of his own.” You rebutled. Swallowing the massive bite you just took. “I’m as much in the friend zone as you, Ned.”

“It could happen,” he shrugged his shoulders-his back pack making a loud jingling. No doubt the Lego pieces. “Maybe you should tell him yourself, sometimes guys like a girl who takes charge.”

“Yeah, and when I’m done with that I’ll ask Spiderman to go out with me next. Or better yet, Captain America- he’s been single a while now.”

The two of you had made it to the Parker residence, Peter shockingly wasn’t home yet-it was nearly dark. But May offered his room for you to hang out in while she made dinner. Once again Ned steered the conversation towards you and Peter before you glared at him to stop.

“The Death Star is nearly complete, my master.” Ned dropped his voice low, trying his best.

“Well done, Lord Vader.” You cackled. Finishing the Lego masterpiece in silence, Ned slowly began to lift it from the bed. It was late and Peter still want home-you may as well call it a night.

But Ned’s eyes went wide, fixated on the cieling. There crawling on all fours, Spiderman suit and all was Peter. You couldn’t breath or even think. He slung a web closing the door silently.

Landing just as silently on the ground Peter turned meeting your eyes and Ned’s. The crash from your Lego creation falling to the ground made you jump.

“what was that?” May called.

Peter franticly squeaked out this response, holding out his hand as if that would keep her from entering the room.

“You’re the Spiderman…” Ned was stunned.

Your ears couldn’t make out any sound as you stared at Peters suit. It was a shiny onesie. He slapped at the emblem on his chest, the suit falling I’m a heap at his feet. He was now nearly naked and almost instantly you were in reality again.

“oh Jesus Peter, warn a girl.” You spun around covering your eyes-leaning against the cold bars of his bunk bed ladder.

“Sorry, Sorry” he scrambled around looking for clothes when May walked in.

“well that didn’t….Peter. What …. ” She stammered, and you could only guess why. “What are you doing? Put some clothes on, Y/N you should come with me.”

“Love to, May. But I can’t really open my eyes at this moment. I’m good here as long as Peter gets dressed.”

“Aunt May I’m so sorry I totally forgot that she was in here.” Peter argued and you could feel your heart sink to your stomach.

Hearing the click from the door the awkward tension burst with chaos. Ned and Peter began to banter about him being Spiderman and something about the internship. You couldn’t really focus. You had seen Peter in gym class and once last summer at a pool party.

His physique hadn’t been that good at the time. Your mind was tracing every line of his muscles in my your memory, licking your lips at the idea.

“Y/N, you should go with Ned.” Peters soft voice made your eyes pop open. He had on a shirt but was still in his boxers- at at least the main distraction had passed.

“Yeah, that’s a good idea.” You grabbed your bag, vaugely hearing apologies from Peter as you and Ned left the apartment.

“So, at least now when you tell Peter how you feel you’ll knock out two birds with one stone.” You groaned at the joke.

Avengers Upstate New York Present Day

“I shouldn’t have let him stay, but the kid just doesn’t listen.” Tony had been rambling on since you had arrived at the complex. He was silent the ride up and it was then that you knew it couldn’t be good.

“I wouldn’t have known who to tell, but Parker was so big on home videos- he had tons with you two-and when I saw the mask footage from his old suit…”

“You still keep track of those, I thought the baby monitor had been removed.” Ned interrupted.

“Ned, for the love of god-not now.” You hissed.

“He was particularly fond of you.” Tony’s eyes landed on you-the pain in them making you feel like your stomach was receding into a black hole.

“Girlfriend?” He asked. You only nodded.

“Fairly recent…” Your voice cracking.

“Then my apologies and sympathy can’t be expressed enough.” Tonys own voice faltering.

“Tony,” you knew you should have called him Mr. Stark- it was only respectful. His body tensed but he didn’t turn. You weren’t sure of your courage in that second-but you knew there was only one thing you could do- the only thing you could say to make sense of your grief.

“Bring him back.”

“Kid, if I could….."he sniffed "I would.”

“Not good enough,” you growled “There must be a way.”

“Y/N….” Ned was crying - accepting defeat

“There has to be something.” Your tears stung your eyes-you hadn’t cried it all out yet.
